basics.name: Valentin Kapitany
basics.label: Researcher
summary: I am an AI-focused researcher at Microsoft, specialising in model improvement and real-time applications in image processing. Through my postdoctoral research position and PhD at the University of Glasgow, I have experience in generative AI, optics and classical data science. I have experience in productizing ML systems from my roles at both Microsoft and the University of Glasgow.

work.name: Microsoft Research
highlights: Inference optimisation: Improved AI throughput by 5x on Project Silica, a data storage initiative. I analysed, optimised and deployed GPU and CPU based pipelines at the source code, compiler (TensorRT) and kernel (PyCUDA) level.
Productization: Evaluated best GPU platform and R&D timeline for our models.
Cloud: Analysed and debugged Azure jobs.

work.name: University of Glasgow
highlights: Computer vision: Developed and trained CNN and transformer-based models for super-resolution, image registration & denoising.
AI Spinout: Worked on spinning out a metal detection technology, using radar & LiDAR, enabled by real-time (TensorFlow Lite) AI on a Raspberry Pi.
AI explainability: Visualising information and uncertainty in deep neural networks.
